summary: As of June 2023, the Department of Justice has brought federal fraud-related charges against at least 2,191 individuals or entities in cases involving federal COVID-19 relief programs, consumer scams, and more. Of the cases we reviewed, at least 1,525 individuals or entities facing fraud-related charges were found guilty or liable. Courts have ordered prison terms up to 10 years or more and restitution up to...
title: COVID-19: Insights from Fraud Schemes and Federal Response Efforts
